title: game freezing after 7.1 patch(mac)
body: After the new patch my game has been freezing while walking from base to lane or recalling. this has never happened before and its not a connection or low fps issue. my ping stays the same and my fps stays constant. I see other mac users have been having the same issue. please fix soon as the game is unplayable at the moment

replies.body: I have had the same problem. I can hear the game going on in the background but the screen is frozen in place. If I Alt+Tab out and back in a few times, it seems to temporarily solve the problem. It usually happens 2 or 3 times a game.

It seems all users with the freeze (0 FPS all of a sudden, with all other functions continue normally) issue are new macbook pro (touch bar) models.

FYI
Here is a possible solution from a RIOT customer support staff:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
You'll want to log into the game and leave it running in the background. Then complete the following:
Select your 'Applications' folder on your Dock
Select 'Open in Finder'
Right Click on 'League of Legends'
Select 'Show Package Contents'
Select 'Contents'
Select 'LoL'
Delete the folder named 'Config' (Right Click, then select 'Move to trash', then empty your trash)
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
reference: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/25074438?page=1

I just played a smooth AI game, will do more tests later to see if it actually solves the problem. At least it worth a try for you guys.

Do you see an *attempting to reconnect* message or anything else? When you say "freeze" do you mean your entire computer freezes and no keys or mouse actions happen? Or would you say that your champ doesn't take inputs during this time, but you are free to move the camera, press buttons or use your mouse?

On top of this I noticed that my hot corners are working as I play the game, so if I try to move my camera to the top right corner of my screen it sends me out of the game because my hot corners are set to show mission control. This hasn't ever been an issue in the past. Game breaking issue for me. I look forward to Riot's response!

I am having the same issue and if its the same issue as me the game is responding and I can make actions however the screen itself just freezes on one picture while the game is still going on in the background.  In addition there are no attempting to reconnect messages and I have to alt tab and reenter game for it to catch back up. and happens very often in a game. this issue also only happen in league itself.

I am a Mac user on their newest laptop computer and I am having the same problem

During gameplay, the screen will just absolutely freeze. The game in the background is still working and I know this cause I can hear my self recall, move around, attacking things, hear the shop opening, etc. I can Command-Tab out of the game and then back in which will fix it momentarily--sometimes just for a couple of seconds, and sometimes for 10 mins plus.

Let me know if you need any more information on this

The situation is like that the FPS is suddenly 0. Game sounds are still going on and the cursor is not frozen and you can give commands to your champion. (you will be able to hear it but not see it since the screen is frozen)

A temporary solution is to cmd+tab to switch to other apps and then switch back to LoL game window to temporarily fix it, but it might occur again sooner or later.

Borderless Mode or Window Mode won't have the issue, but the game is extremely laggy (screen is laggy, not the network, ping is fine, fps is much lower than full screen mode, but the screen is yet much laggier than what the fps should indicate, for e.g. a 70fps will be as laggy as 20~30fps) in those two modes and almost not possible to play.

It happens on my new retina MacBook Pro 15 inch with touch bar since 7.1, but fine on my friends' old MacBook Pro machines.

I think the cause is that something modified from 6.24 to 7.1 is not compatible with some unique features of the new MacBook Pros. Just FYI
I am also playing on the new retina MacBook Pro 15 inch with touch bar. My girlfriend is playing on the older model of the MacBook Pro and does not  seem to have this problem.

The graphics freeze for the new MBPs (with game and audio still running) seems to be related to the Mac mouse settings of increasing the cursor on shake.  I've disabled that for the past 5 days and I haven't had a freeze since.  To disable the cursor getting larger, you can do the following:

> 
> System Preferences -> Accessibility -> Display -> "Shake mouse pointer to locate."
> 

If you turn off "shake mouse pointer to locate," your mouse will no longer get large when you shake it.  Disabling this fixed the graphics freeze for me for the past five days (MBP Late 2016 15'' Inch).  Figured I'd share with y'all.  Hope it works for you guys too!
Thank you, this was it for me!
Any update on this? I have exactly the same problem, but still happens after I disable "shake mouse pointer to locate"

Sounds like my problem is the same as all of yours. I've had more success using the three finger touch to bump it into the side (meaning if its desktop number 1 I bump it to the left into aka nothing). This has been a much faster way to unfreeze the screen for me. Hope riot figures out a fix soon though.

I am also having this on new 15-inch Macbook Pro Sierra OS 10.12.2 and it's after the 7.1 patch.

As described, the screen freezes in place. Only cmd+tab in and out fixes the frozen screen temporarily. Happens quite often, 5+ times a game for me.
